Package pt.runtime

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    GuiThreadProxy
    An interface that defines the services that the proxies of different virtual machine GUI threads should provide for the ParaTask framework.
    Taskpool
    Classes which implement this interface provide specifications regarding scheduling policies such as:
    1- How to deal with tasks that are ready to be executed.
    2- How to enqueue tasks (i.e.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractTaskListener  
    AbstractTaskPool  
    GuiEdtTaskListener
    A task listener that execute event handlers on EDT.
    GuiThread
    This class instantiates an instance of a GUI thread proxy, based on the underlying virtual machine.
    GuiThreadAndroidDynamic
    This class provides a proxy to Android GUI thread, through which ParaTask framework retrieves information about the Android GUI thread.
    GuiThreadSwing  
    InteractiveThread  
    ParaTask  
    Slot<T>
    This class allows the user to define a handler from one of the Functor types (functional interfaces) which could be done by using lambda expressions as well.
    TaskID<T>
    A future object representing a task invocation.
    TaskIDGroup<T>
    An extension of TaskID to contain multiple tasks.
    TaskInfo<R>
    This class is used to store information regarding the task, which is not related to its execution time.
    TaskInfoEightArgs<R,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8>  
    TaskInfoElevenArgs<R,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,T10,T11>

    TaskInfoSixArgs<R,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6>  
    TaskInfoTenArgs<R,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,T10>  
    TaskInfoThreeArgs<R,T1,T2,T3>  
    TaskInfoTwelveArgs<R,T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,T7,T8,T9,T10,T11,T12>  
    TaskInfoTwoArgs<R,T1,T2>  
    TaskpoolFactory
    Is a factory class that provides only one instance of TaskPool which is configured according to the scheduling type specified by ParaTask.
    TaskpoolFIFOWorkSharing
    This class extends AbstractTaskPool which is an implementation of TaskPool and uses Work Sharing policy for scheduling tasks.
    TaskpoolLIFOWorkStealing
    There is no global OneOff task queue, all tasks are placed on private queues in a round-robin fashion.
    TaskpoolMixedScheduling
    The mixed scheduling policy is a combination of Work Stealing and Work Sharing policies, such that when enqueuing a task, if the enqueuing thread is a worker thread, the Work Stealing policy is used, and if the enqueuing thread is a non-worker thread, the Work Sharing policy is used!

    A worker thread potentially prefers to execute tasks from its own localOneOffTask queue before helping with the global shared queue!
    TaskThread
    This class which extends the java.lang.Thread class facilitates creating tasks threads with their own IDs.
    ThreadPool  
    ThreadRedundancyHandler  
    WorkerThread
